org.vaadin.addons.criteriacontainer
Class CritQueryDefinition<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.LazyQueryDefinition
      org.vaadin.addons.criteriacontainer.CritQueryDefinition<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.QueryDefinition
Direct Known Subclasses:
ParameterizedTaskQueryDefinition, SimpleTaskQueryDefinition, TaskQueryDefinition
public class CritQueryDefinition<T>
extends org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.LazyQueryDefinition

Definition of a JPA 2.0 Criteria Query. Extends LazyQueryDefinition instead of EntityQueryDefinition to avoid passing the Entity class.

Author:
jflamy
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

CritQueryDefinition

public CritQueryDefinition(boolean applicationManagedTransactions,
                           Class<T> entityClass,
                           int batchSize,
                           Object[] nativeSortPropertyIds,
                           boolean[] nativeSortPropertyAscendingStates)
Constructor for simple usage. With this constructor, entities are retrieved and sorted. The container's CriteriaContainer#filter(Map) is used to restrict information.

Parameters:
applicationManagedTransactions - true unless the JPA persistence unit is defined by the container
entityClass - the class for the entity (should be the same as T when the class is instanciated)
batchSize - how many entities to recover at one time.
nativeSortPropertyIds -
nativeSortPropertyAscendingStates -
Throws:
InstantiationException
IllegalAccessException

CritQueryDefinition

                           Class<T> entityClass,
                           int batchSize)

Parameters:

entityClass - the class for the entity (should be the same as T when the class is instanciated)
batchSize - how many entities to recover at one time.

setRestrictions

public final void setRestrictions(Collection<CritRestriction> restrictions)
Store a list of restrictions. Each restriction will be transformed into a predicate added to the WHERE clause.

Parameters:
restrictions -

addFilterRestrictions

protected List<javax.persistence.criteria.Predicate> addFilterRestrictions(List<javax.persistence.criteria.Predicate> filterExpressions,
                                                                           javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder cb,
                                                                           javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaQuery<?> cq,
                                                                           javax.persistence.criteria.Root<T> t)
Prepare the query so that CriteriaContainer#filter(Map) works. For each field named in the whereParameters map, create a parameter place holder in the query. There is no setFilterParameters method, the container does the processing in the filter() method.

Parameters:
filterExpressions -
cb -
cq -
t -
Returns:

                                                                   javax.persistence.criteria.Root<T> t)

Parameters:
filterExpressions2 - a list of Predicate objects. Note: you may use the cb.parameter() method to create additional parameters.

defineQuery

protected javax.persistence.criteria.Root<T> defineQuery(javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder cb,
                                                         javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaQuery<?> cq)
Define FROM and WHERE part of query. This definition is shared between the query returning items and the count. Must call nb.from(), must call nb.where() for the parameter place holders.

Parameters:
cb -
nb -
Returns:

setParameters

protected javax.persistence.TypedQuery<?> setParameters(javax.persistence.TypedQuery<?> tq)
Set parameters values. Provide values for the named parameters defined viasetNamedParameterValues(java.util.Map). This method is overridden by subclasses that define additional parameters.

Parameters:
tq -
